nodes.bodyText: Why this

The Unit test failed with an NPE because of the IDE implementation. I used the runtime binding and resolved it with it. I can attach a stacktrace of the failing test. If I can resolve it another way I'll try to.
please do so
Will push a commit that fixes the NPE
Thanks for the hints. I'll consider that fix.

s/that the/the/
s/are to/to/

nodes.bodyText: @since 2.24 on the class is enhough
please move the @sinces after the @auther (check also other places)
please remove final from parameters (for fields it is ok)
remove finals from variables
finals
finals
finals
finals
no constant for issue code
move to validator
use new ArrayList<>() and remove the Unmodifiable list
check for unused imports
please inline the "_" local vars
remove finals
i wonder if we should mark this as @Beta. that do you think @szarnekow
i wonder if we should mark this as @Beta. that do you think @szarnekow
unused import
Thanks. I noticed a lot of .project and .classpath files. Do you generally gitignore eclipse prefs? Can I add/enhance save actions? I'll do an organize imports over my files anyway.

nope. they should be (as) checked in.
but as we are in transition to Java 11 such
discrepancies as yours may happen unfortunately
unused imports
remove finals

@cdietrich I will move this into testlang and this class will be removed. I'll check if there are any finals left, thanks.
I already implemented the IDE bindings in QuickfixProviderFragment2, so this could be added, too, if you wanted.
shouldnt the to upper case which mimics the quickfix be dropped here?
ahh no, that one is a command
Do you mean the hard-coded one from before? Would be OK with me, I can adapt the test accordingly.

both things do a to upper case.
do we need both.
if i read your quickfixcode action service correct it does a code acction not a command?

so maybe we should change it to
command.setTitle("Make '" + string + "' upper case (Command)");

but the impl is bogus as there is no edit command in
TestLanguageExecutableCommandService
=> have no idea why the current impl is as it is
Ok, I'll just drop the "old" one and use the quickfix action instead in the tests. Then we have a real implementation test.

i wonder if we want to have a testcase for command code action anyway thus having both would be better.
even if its not completely implemented
please restore. otherwise we would have code action as command untested.
Ok, then I'll do as you suggested
i assume the test (framework) can handle multiple results. correct?
yes

nodes.bodyText: i assume this class can be dropped/is redundant now?
It basically tests the same stuff, so yes 😄 -> removed
Can we agree on throwing UnsupportedOperationException in the methods that are no-ops?
it might be called.but we dont seem to care here
Added the throw
Hmm this mock im looks far too much like a mock to me. Please add a comment why newLiveScopeResourceSet does not create a new resource set.
//re-using the existing ResourceSet because it contains the URI protocol mapping for "inmemory" resources. perhaps?
Nit: This line deserves a formatter to add spaces.
Should we also normalize the fileContents to unix line endings?
I'll do that here, pack it into a variable and pass it to the in-mem resource and method
The code looks still to much like the Xtend-generated Java. Please do some more cleanup, e.g. Quickfix instead of AbstractIdeQuickfixTest.Quickfix
Is this a QuickfixExpectation?
I can rename that, yes
Is this an expectation rather than a result?
Formatting
Also the method name does not tell what this routine does.
It's overridden, I'll rename the method to "findFirstOfTypeInFile" if it's OK.
Java is happier with a normal "string" + "contatenation"
This base class could offer a method Quickfix expect(String, String, String)
If we make this class package private, the bindings of the factory become meaningless since nobody can ever implement a subtype of the context.
